Text.Value: Zarys' chest? I bet it holds all sorts of treasures.
Zarys was looking for this chest. Whatever it holds must be valuable.
They did not want to part with that chest. And their boss promised good coin if it stays locked.
Zarys was looking for this chest. Surely there's something valuable inside.
Zarys' treasure. Must be something good.
Looks like Zarys' missing shipment. It must be hiding quite the treasure.
The chest's clearly worth a lot to the Zhentarim, if it's returned unopened.
Hm - but it does raise a question: what if its contents are more valuable than the reward?
Is her reward more precious than the contents of the chest? Doubtable.
She was very clear that we shouldn't open it... but what if we did, though?
She'll pay handsomely for its safe return... but what's inside that she cares about so much?
But maybe it's worth more than the prize money, right?
Let's hope our fee isn't worth less than its contents.
Yes, but who knows what's inside? It could be worth more than any purse she'll offer.
You don't hide trinkets in a box like that. There's something good rattling around in there.
A weighty-looking chest. What treasures might that be filled with?
An unusual chest. The sort that holds more than just a few worthless baubles.
That's a curious-looking chest. I wonder what's inside.
Now that's what I call a chest. More than just a few trinkets in there, I wager.
What a chest.
You don't craft a chest like that to hold trinkets. There must be something valuable inside.
Well - let's pry it open and have a look.
Why wonder, when we can find out for ourselves?
So what are we waiting for? Let's crack it open and see.
No harm in taking a peek, surely.
Let's crack it open!
Only one way to find out. Time to indulge our curiosity.
Well, there's only one way to know for sure.
Zarys was looking for this chest. She will pay handsomely if I return it intact.
Zarys promised a reward for this chest. A sizeable one - provided it stayed unopened.
That Zhent woman promised a lot of coin for this chest, but only if we don't peek inside.
Zarys was looking for this chest. If we want to bring it back to her, we should keep it intact.
This is Zarys' chest. Would probably be worth a few coin to her.
Looks like Zarys' missing shipment. The one she was most insistent we return unopened.
Zarys promised good coin for an unopened chest. If we want to collect, it needs to stay shut.

EditorData.logicalname: 2-Speakers, on Zarys quest, didn't trick Rugan

Text.Value: Zarys was looking for this chest. She will pay handsomely if I return it intact.
Zarys promised a reward for this chest. A sizeable one - if I return it unopened.
That Zhent woman promised a lot of coin for this chest, as long as I don't peek inside...
Zarys wanted this chest. She will pay handsomely if we return it intact.
This is Zarys' chest. Must be worth a lot to her.
The chest Zarys sought, if I'm not mistaken. She'll pay handsomely to get that back.
So this is Zarys' chest? She promised good coin, if it's returned unopened.
You don't hide trinkets in a box like that. There must be something good rattling around in there.
Not your average chest.  Whatever's inside is worth a peek, I'd say.
An unusual chest. The sort that holds more than just a few worthless baubles.
That's no common travelling chest. Might be worth a peek inside...
Now that's what I call a chest. More than just a few trinkets in there, I wager.
Bet there's something impressive in there.
Chests like that don't hold trinkets. There must be something valuable inside.
Zarys' chest? I bet it holds all sorts of treasures.
Zarys was looking for this chest. Whatever it holds must be valuable.
They did not want to part with that chest. And their boss promised good coin if it stays locked.
The chest Zarys sought. I wonder what its safe return is worth to her...
Zarys' chest. Must be worth a good bit.
The chest Zarys sought, if I'm not mistaken. What treasures is it hiding?
The chest's clearly worth a lot to the Zhentarim, if it's returned unopened.

EditorData.logicalname: Solo, on Zarys quest, tricked Rugan

Text.Value: We could always return it. Or maybe...
Well, I see no reason to return it. Let's see what's inside.
Yes, but why tell us not to open it unless there's something very good inside?
Whatever's inside belongs to us now.
May as well crack it open, right?
Only one way to find out. Unless we plan to ask the Zhentarim for a shipping manifest.
It's our chest now. We can do whatever we want with it.

Synopsis: This PAD was converted from a RD where the party were discussing what to do with a valuable chest they've found. It triggers when agents are not nearby and a character picks up the chest or tries to open it, or deals with the agents and then notices the chest in the cave.
